author: Mod Ash
quote: It's stored as a 32-bit INT that's treated as a fixed-point number with one decimal place. So it'll take numbers up to 2 billion, which it treats as numbers up to 200,000,000.0, hence the 200 million XP cap you see.

author: Mod Ash
quote: The system can handle numbers up to 2.147 billion. It's storing a decimal place for the XP, so that'd be okay up to 214.7 million. And the original devs apparently decided to cap it at a round number.

author: Mod Ash
quote: Define X = (((Fishing level x 2) + Hunter level) / 3). Pick a random number 0 to (X-1) inclusive. If it's 82+ it'll give a siren if you have the stats. If it's 67+ it'll give an eel if you have the stats. If it's 52+ it'll give a tench if you have the stats. Else bluegill.

author: Mod Ash
quote:
For pearls, take the X from above (https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1139091986865111041) and:
Subtract 40.
Divide by 59 and multiply by 25 in *one step*, NOT rounding between them.
Subtract the result from 100; that's your pearl chance.
If X were 80, (100 - (((80-40) / 59) * 25)) = 84, i.e. 1/84 chance.

quote: No, it can be different for different crops in each patch too, or even different for each growth state of each crop.

author: Mod Kieren
quote: So with the release of Ultracompost I figured I'd explain how compost affects crops dying. Sorry it is very word heavy! Fire any questions:).
notes: Note: The image in the tweet says the ultracompost multiplier is 1/7, but later in the thread it is corrected to 1/10. Additionally, the image says "Fruit Trees have 4 chances of becoming diseased" but it's actually five, as can be seen in Apple tree seed for example. Therefore his statement that "fruit trees have a 96.9% chance of surviving" if using ultracompost is incorrect -- it is actually 96.15%. Additionally, collected data shows that it is overwhelmingly likely that when creating the graphic, Kieren adjusted the denominator by one to account for a random roll of 0-127, but did not also adjust the numerator, hence the difference in table by +1.

author: Mod Ash
quote: [Does watering crops eliminate chance of disease for one grow cycle stage or just reduce it?] It just reduces it. - [Got it. In that case, how much does watering reduce chance of disease?] There isn't a formula as far as I know - the dev who made the skill just set different numbers.

quote: It's stored as a 32-bit INT that's treated as a fixed-point number with one decimal place. So it'll take numbers up to 2 billion, which it treats as numbers up to 200,000,000.0, hence the 200 million XP cap you see.

author: Mod Ash
notes: Player: "Need clarity on this: harvesting limpwurts is a base of 3 + scaling +1 for each 10 levels, 90-99 being +9, does boosting to 100+ then result in +10?" Mod Ash: "It's picking a random number between 0 and (stat - 1) inclusive. So if you boost to 101, it has a small chance to roll 100, which would give the +10. (in addition to the base of 3)" Player: "Thanks, are there any other farming patches/crops that are affected by boosts above 100?" Mod Ash: "Belladonna has something similar."

author: Mod Ash
quote: For herbs, the percentages are added for the secateurs and cape, then applied, then the Kandarin effect is multplied on afterwards.
notes: In response to the question: "Do the farming yield percentage bonuses from magic secateurs, farming cape, and kandarin diary stack additively or multiplicatively?"

author: Mod Ash
quote: [Do you have the function that says how likely you are to use a "life" from a limpwurt root patch? If not the level 99 and level 1 rates, then what about just level 99, or the expected number at 99?] That one doesn't have the "life" mechanic, does it? I think it just picks a number of roots and gives them to you. That's 3 + a random number. For levels 90-99 the max random number is 8. For levels 80-89 the max random number is 7, etc. Boosts are accepted.
notes: Note: The numbers in the citation appear to be off by one, and they were later corrected within the thread. With an attas seed planted, it is possible to obtain 13 limpwurt roots, hence higher average.

author: Mod Ash
quote: 3 [lives] as standard. Add 1-3 for the tier of compost you used. The chance scales from 59% - 82% of NOT taking a life when you get an item, as your level goes from 1-99. Secateurs are ignored; they'd be a pain to take there anyway.
notes: In response to the question: "How many "lives" do Giant Seaweed patches have with/without compost? What's the % chance of taking one of these "lives" relative to farming lvl? Do magic secateurs work on seaweed patches?"

author: Mod Ash
quote: Define X = (((Fishing level x 2) + Hunter level) / 3). Pick a random number 0 to (X-1) inclusive. If it's 82+ it'll give a siren if you have the stats. If it's 67+ it'll give an eel if you have the stats. If it's 52+ it'll give a tench if you have the stats. Else bluegill.

author: Mod Ash
quote:
Assuming I'm reading this correctly...
If choosing both, you receive A in Agility and T in Thieving where:
A = (3 x (Agility * Agility)) / 150
T = (11 x (Thieving * Thieving)) / 150
If choosing just Agility, you get 1.5 x A.
If choosing just Thieving, you get 1.5 x T.
notes: Note: The data in this tweet is outdated; the 16 May 2019 update to this content on added a times 0.9 to the formulas.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: We're turning Old School RuneScape off for a while whilst we investigate a potential issue. Apologies for any inconvenience, we'll return service as soon as we're able to!

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: A bug involving Twisted Bows and the Farming guild has been hotfixed. Stand by while we assess our next steps. If you have acquired a Twisted Bows from anywhere other than Chambers of Xeric, they will be removed - attempting to sell them may result in action against your account.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: We will use means other than a rollback to address the bug. This is to avoid turning Old School off for several hours and interrupting your in-game experience. We are working with our Analytics team to identify and track the Twisted bows that entered the game.

author: Mod Wolf
quote: The worlds should be back up and the Twisted Bow is no longer at its previous location.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote:
We'd like to apologise for any inconvenience, due to a problem with players' save games we're turning the game off temporarily.

We're just as excited for Darkmeyer as you are, and we're working the bring the game back online as soon as possible.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote:
We're going to rollback the game which will mean it remains offline for a few hours. We'll keep you updated throughout.

We'd like to apologise again, and we greatly appreciate your patience whilst we resolve this issue.

author: Mod Ash
quote: Yeah, an engine change has made a LOT of actions faster. We're shutting the game down until this can be resolved - though we are not planning a rollback over this.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: We will be shutting the game down shortly to fix an issue regarding the speed of making certain items. This is accompanied with a 5-minute in-game timer. Apologies for the inconvenience.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: Due to issues with League save profiles, we are going to be shutting the game down very shortly. Unfortunately, we are required to perform a rollback to just before the launch of Leagues III. Apologies for the inconvenience and we will update you with more information soon.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: We've identified that the rollback will only be required for main game progress, setting players back to just before the update. The Hiscores for Leagues will be reset, but all progress made on a Leagues world will be available when the game is back online.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: The game has been temporarily shut down whilst we investigate reports of bugs regarding untradeable items. We will keep you posted as we're able to! Apologies for the inconvenience.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: Due to the severity of the identified issues, a rollback of the game is required. We'll be going back to just moments before today's update. We apologise for the inconvenience this will cause and we'll share more info as soon as we can.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: üì¢PSA: We're taking game worlds offline urgently as we're investigating an issue with player display names. Apologies for any inconvenience caused, a 15-min timer has been sent out. We've also turned off the ability to change your display name both in-game and via the website.

author: Old School RuneScape
quote: üì¢ The team is hard at work investigating the issues with player display names. To resolve the issue, we'll be reverting all display names back to their previous state (from 9:30AM GMT today). Apologies for any inconvenience caused.

author: Mod Ash

author: Mod Kieren
quote: Every 90seconds, the cat grows 1 "growth cycle". After 120 growth cycles, it grows. Logging resets back to the start of a 90 second cycle.

author: Mod Ash
quote: While the loading section wouldn't count for growth time, if a timer restarts every time you log in, and you hop again before it gets round to ticking, you could postpone it for a long time if you keep re-logging or hopping.

author: Mod Ash
quote: [Hey Ash! Does the kitten timer run during dialogues?] No, it pauses.

author: Mod Ash
quote: [does interacting and feeding kittens at the last possible moment cause it to grow slower than interacting with it more frequently?] No, it just deducts a bit from the the 'needing to be stroked' counter or 'needing to be fed' counter, without affecting the timers that make those increase over time.

author: TheLonchClob
quote: Coming soon, Old School RuneScape as you've never played it before: a high school romance! Get to know TzTok-Jad, Graardor and The Nightmare as you rebuild the Boss Club, overcome life's challenges, and maybe... find love?!

author: Mod Gambit
quote:
Hi gamers.

It's time for me to take the next step in my career, meaning this'll be my last week at Jagex.

I'd like to thank Jagex & the OSRS team, as well as all of you for sharing your passion for the game. 

I'll still be around on Twitter, sharing my next adventure!

author: Mod Ghost
quote:
Hi, I've had a great time creating art for Old School RuneScape and it's community! Now it's time for me to pursue a new adventure in my artistic development. 

I'm certain that Old School RuneScape will continue to move from strength to strength in the years ahead.

Thank you.

author: Mod Grimoire
quote: It was my last day at Jagex yesterday as an Intern Game Engineer, I really enjoyed the 3 months so much!

author: Mod Grimoire
quote: I worked on core gameplay mechanics for the unannounced mmorpg and some secret titlescreen stuff which hasn't been announced yet for OSRS!

author: Mod Grimoire
quote: My first publicly announced contribution to a game in the games industry!! A Volume Slider in the titlescreen of OSRS!

author: Mod Ash
quote: I'm afraid that person no longer works here and isn't expected to be around.

author: Mod Jerv
quote: Today was my last day as a Concept art intern! I really enjoyed these 3 months at Jagex, and you guys made me feel very welcome!

author: Mod Lenny
quote: Our scrum teams all shuffled around a while ago, so I'm heading up one called The Gang, nowadays, but it's the same team at its core, working all all things client-related - there are some added responsibilities across the wider team, though.

author: OldSchoolRS
quote: We also say a heartfelt farewell to @JagexMatK. Thank you for all your work on Old School RuneScape. You'll be greatly missed, Mat! The newspost contains a message from Mat to you - the community.

author: Mod Maz
quote: OS and RS players. Thank you all for your inspiration and ideas, friendship and feedback over the years. It's been an honour and now my journey comes to an end.

author: Mod Munro
quote:
It is with great sadness to tell you I have left the Old School Team and Jagex.

I have had such a great time working with the team and delivering new content in the past 8 months.

I wish the team and the community all the best in the future, keep on doing what you love <3

author: Mod Ash
quote: Nexus asked to move back to RS3 in the late summer of 2013, since he thought there'd be more interesting project possibilities there. And since then, he's left the studio.

author: Mod Nin
quote: Howdy gamers, a lil update from me - After 3 years on RS and 3 on OSRS, I'm sad to be leaving Jagex at the end of this week. The OSRS team is a culture dedicated to bringing the best out of the game, and a really awesome bunch of people that have all been a pleasure to work with!

author: Mod Nin
quote: Seen so much positive feedback on today's OSRS Android Beta! ü•≥ Also seen a ton of suggestions, and I just want to impatiently get them all done and shipped already! Most of them have already been discussed before so I'm just gonna drop my thoughts here (thread)

author: Mod Ash
quote:
For pearls, take the X from above (https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1139091986865111041) and:
Subtract 40.
Divide by 59 and multiply by 25 in *one step*, NOT rounding between them.
Subtract the result from 100; that's your pearl chance.
If X were 80, (100 - (((80-40) / 59) * 25)) = 84, i.e. 1/84 chance.

author: Mod Ash
quote:
At level 1 Agility, the first time they try a slippery bit, the success chance is 33.3%.
At level 99 Agility, it starts at 117.6% (guaranteed pass).
Interpolate linearly between those.
Every time they fail, this increases by +2.4%, i.e. the level 1 player gets 35.7%, 38.1%, etc.

author: Mod Ash
quote: NPCs would have an internal order for their actions to be processed, like PID, yup. When there are multiple viable targets in their aggression range, the engine's documentation says they pick randomly.

author: Mod Ash
quote: [Hi Ash, do you have any insight to what npcs barrage will hit if there is a stack of 10. It doesn't seem to randomise every hit but I don't see a pattern with npc.Index.] The engine doesn't document a priority order for them. It may well turn out to be the NPC equivalent of PID, though for players I believe the spells tend to pick the north/west players slightly more than south/east.

author: Mod Ash
quote: [When two players (not the currently logged in player) or more stand above each other how does the game determine who to render and who to hide?] The game client has an internal ID for each player too, and prioritises them based on that (unless there's a special override in effect, which we sometimes use). It's distinct from the PID system you're familiar with, since that shuffles periodically.

author: Mod Ash
quote: [Hey @JagexAsh how are the prayer enhance formulas calculated? So far I've found for the ticks to regen 1 prayer point it's been anywhere from 13t (11 prayer) to 6t (99 prayer). Amount of times it regens seems to be floor((level/2) + 31), but I could be wrong on that. Thanks!] I think you're right for the number of times it'll regen, for a strong one. The number of ticks between them is 500 divided by that number, or 63, whichever is lower.

author: Mod Ash
quote: It is not rolled as a chance on each tick. It picks a time when your next one is due, and when that time rolls round, the game aims to give you one if you're available. [What would the range for the time it can pick be?] About 1-2 hours.

author: Mod Ash
quote: [Is that duration tied to a global timer or login timer? (...)] Global timer, if I recall correctly. (...)

author: Mod Ash
quote: 60-120 mins. It checks every few mins to see if the time has elapsed, so you'll probably find it's not evenly distributed.

author: Mod Ash
quote: All the events for which you're eligible at the time have equal weighting. Eligibility depends mostly on where you are. For example, only certain events can work underwater, and if you shouldn't be teleported then the game will pick only from events that don't teleport you.

author: Mod Ash
quote: If you were offline when the time came for your next one, yes, it'll move itself forward by 10-70 mins and carry on ticking.

author: Mod Ash
quote: If you're in an ineligible location, I think you do indeed just miss it and a new duration is set. I can't check that from here though.

author: Mod Ash
quote: Random events will not happen while you're transmogrified, so the genie would delete itself when it realised you'd equipped that.

author: Mod Ash
quote: It does a brief check to see if there's already a random event NPC (belonging to you) loitering close to you. But - as others have pointed out - the time between them makes this pretty irrelevant.

author: Mod Ash
quote: [what determines what random events you are able to get? (...)] Some avoid coming during combat, if I recall correctly, though I'd not be able to check the code for you from here.

author: Mod Ash
quote: They aren't forceable on demand, though if you're due for one, you might stall it for a while by leaving a menu open, in which case it'd likely turn up soon after you closed the menu, which would look a bit like forcing it.

author: Mod Ash
quote: If you're in the middle of a Make-X repeated action, I think it will avoid interrupting you by spawning one, yes.

author: Mod Ash
quote: The random events generally won't put you back on a blocked tile, lest you get trapped somewhere, so they'd default to Lumbridge. Sorry!

author: Mod Ash
quote: If you were on a tile that became blocked, the random event would not want to put you back on it. E.g. rockfall.

author: Mod Ash
quote: They're blocked in designated areas, and (pre-OSRS) Hunter training areas were commonly designated as such. There may be some areas that don't have such a restriction.

author: Mod Ash
quote: Let X = typical damage value. Principal target is hit for X+2. The game picks a random number 0-X (inclusive), and sets X to it. 1st splashed NPC is hit for X. The game picks a random number 0-X (inclusive), and sets X to it. 2nd splashed NPC is hit for X. i.e. It decreases.

author: Mod Ash
quote: It had some pretty bad bugs in 2007. I asked to leave it locked until I'd had a chance to rewrite the climactic cutscene that caused all the player deaths back then. When the prince reached 0 HP, it wouldn't die, but carried on hitting the player, and the player couldn't move or access their inventory, so they'd likely end up dying. The dev and his supervisor couldn't diagnose it for days, and didn't escalate it to anyone who could. If you're wondering how that happened, it's because the dev wrote the cutscene in a unique way, trying to stop the player clicking out, so the player was frozen and had their inventory blocked by the cutscene behaviour, and the cutscene malfunctioned if the player had a pet.

author: Mod Ash
quote: It looks at your effective ranged defence and your effective magic defence, and takes the average (i.e. add the two numbers, divide by 2). It does the same for the NPC's effective ranged & magic accuracy. It rolls the average accuracy against the average defence. The max hit's calculated off the NPC's stats too, taking its ranged max hit and magic max hit, and using an average of those two numbers.

author: Mod Lenny

author: Mod Husky
name: shards
quote:
Not sure if we mentioned this but when we adjusted the Zalcano drops we changed how many crystal shards are handed out so that players know how many "points" they earned.
* 1 Shard - Player eligible for a drop
* 2 Shards - Player eligible for uniques/pet
* 3 Shards - Player is the MVP
